message.content:
cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper presents a framework for training policies for the adaptive information gathering problem using imitation learning. This problem involves selecting informative sensing locations based on the history of measurements acquired so far. The paper is likely to belong to the cs.AI sub-category as it involves developing intelligent agents that can learn from data. It is also likely to belong to the cs.RO sub-category as it involves developing policies for robotic exploration tasks. The paper uses machine learning techniques such as imitation learning, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.LG sub-category. The paper also presents results on 2D and 3D exploration problems, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.CV sub-category. Finally, the paper involves developing policies that can adapt to different world map distributions, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.SY sub-category.
